title: Ticket #4863: submitter missing in condor_q output
description:
In the test job_schedd_restart-holdjobs-ok we have on some schedd startups, condor_q only has the machine for the submitter on windows. Then when the schedd is turned off and back on, we have the user@machine. Thus when the tests looks for the same output as the first time it fails. It always has the correct user as the owner. See below.

  1. 05:22 Test: submitted
  2. 05:22 Test: Collecting queue details on 1
  3. 05:22 Test:

  4. 05:22 Test:

  5. 05:22 Test: -- Submitter: exec-11.batlab.org : <128.104.103.11:58807> : exec-11.batlab.org

  6. 05:22 Test: ID OWNER SUBMITTED RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE CMD

  7. 05:22 Test: 1.0 condor-slot1 2/2 13:05 0+00:00:00 H 0 0.0 x_echo1234.pl 1

Checking for schedd being off Checking for schedd being on

  1. 05:37 Test: Collecting queue details on 1
  2. 05:37 Test:

  3. 05:37 Test:

  4. 05:37 Test: -- Submitter: condor-slot1@exec-11.batlab.org : <128.104.103.11:46586> : exec-11.batlab.org

  5. 05:37 Test: ID OWNER SUBMITTED RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE CMD

  6. 05:37 Test: 1.0 condor-slot1 2/2 13:05 0+00:00:00 H 0 0.0 x_echo1234.pl 1
